            <gmd:abstract>
                <gco:CharacterString>ACAP Saint John’s Water Quality Monitoring Programs aim to build upon the community-based water monitoring program established in 1992 in the Greater Saint John Area. The data collected from these various monitoring programs is used to track stressors, determine restoration sites, strengthen/shape policy, and expand community partnerships. This includes data collected during ACAP Saint John’s Coastal Baseline Monitoring Program which is part of a larger national monitoring program to address data gaps to areas that do not have comprehensive aquatic baseline data. Water quality data is collected through portable in-situ field meters (all monitoring programs) and grab samples for laboratory analysis (select monitoring programs).</gco:CharacterString>
            </gmd:abstract>

keywords_translation_method.fr: Keyword text translated using the Amazon translate service / texte traduit à l'aide du service Amazon translate

name: 10-25976-4mf6-k783
notes: ACAP Saint John’s Water Quality Monitoring Programs aim to build upon the community-based water monitoring program established in 1992 in the Greater Saint John Area. The data collected from these various monitoring programs is used to track stressors, determine restoration sites, strengthen/shape policy, and expand community partnerships. This includes data collected during ACAP Saint John’s Coastal Baseline Monitoring Program which is part of a larger national monitoring program to address data gaps to areas that do not have comprehensive aquatic baseline data. Water quality data is collected through portable in-situ field meters (all monitoring programs) and grab samples for laboratory analysis (select monitoring programs).

notes_translated.en: ACAP Saint John’s Water Quality Monitoring Programs aim to build upon the community-based water monitoring program established in 1992 in the Greater Saint John Area. The data collected from these various monitoring programs is used to track stressors, determine restoration sites, strengthen/shape policy, and expand community partnerships. This includes data collected during ACAP Saint John’s Coastal Baseline Monitoring Program which is part of a larger national monitoring program to address data gaps to areas that do not have comprehensive aquatic baseline data. Water quality data is collected through portable in-situ field meters (all monitoring programs) and grab samples for laboratory analysis (select monitoring programs).
notes_translated.fr: Les programmes de surveillance de la qualité de l'eau de l'ACAP Saint John visent à tirer parti du programme communautaire de surveillance de l'eau établi en 1992 dans la région du Grand Saint John. Les données recueillies dans le cadre de ces différents programmes de surveillance sont utilisées pour suivre les facteurs de stress, déterminer les sites de restauration, renforcer/façonner les politiques et élargir les partenariats communautaires. Cela inclut les données recueillies dans le cadre du programme de surveillance de base du littoral de l'ACAP Saint John, qui fait partie d'un programme national de surveillance plus vaste visant à combler les lacunes en matière de données dans les zones qui ne disposent pas de données de référence aquatiques complètes. Les données sur la qualité de l'eau sont recueillies au moyen de compteurs de terrain portables in situ (tous les programmes de surveillance) et d'échantillons choisis pour analyse en laboratoire (certains programmes de surveillance).

notes_translation_method.fr: Description text translated using the Amazon translate service / texte traduit à l'aide du service Amazon translate

description_translated.en: DataStream is an open access platform for sharing water and sediment quality data.
description_translated.fr: DataStream est une plateforme en libre accès pour partager des données sur la qualité de l'eau et des sédiments.

title: ACAP Saint John: Community-Based Water Monitoring Program

title_translated.fr: ACAP Saint John : Programme communautaire de surveillance de l'eau
